issue.title: [bug] broken IPC in multi window app on Linux

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

In a multi-window Tauri app on Linux, only the first window ever created can receive events and have its `listen` callbacks triggered. All subsequent windows do not receive any events.

In this video, the same Tauri app runs on Windows on the left and Linux on the right.

Every window ran `listen("reply", (event) => {alert(event.payload})})`.
When the button is pressed, a Rust Tauri command is invoked, which emits the `reply` event.

On Windows, the app behaves correctly and every window receives the `reply` event.

On Linux, only the first window ever receives any events.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b2c0fd72-d7b8-4764-a92d-f82a2dd9af7b



### Reproduction

The example shown in the video: https://github.com/Ynng/tauri-listen-test

Or:

- Clone the tauri repo on an Ubuntu 24 machine
- Run `cargo run --example multiwindow`
- Try to send a message to the second/third window

### Expected behavior

All windows should receive events that are "emitted to all targets".

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Fedora 40.0.0 x86_64 (X64)
    âœ” webkit2gtk-4.1: 2.44.3
    âœ” rsvg2: 2.57.1
    âœ” rustc: 1.80.1 (3f5fd8dd4 2024-08-06)
    âœ” cargo: 1.80.1 (376290515 2024-07-16)
    âœ” rustup: 1.27.1 (54dd3d00f 2024-04-24)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu (environment override by RUSTUP_TOOLCHAIN)
    - node: 21.7.2
    - pnpm: 9.7.1
    - npm: 10.5.0

[-] Packages
    - tauri ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.11
    - tauri-build ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.13
    - wry ðŸ¦€: 0.44.1
    - tao ðŸ¦€: 0.30.2
    - tauri-cli ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.10

[-] Plugins
    - tauri-plugin-shell ðŸ¦€: 2.0.0-rc.0

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

Undoing #11043 fixes this problem, but re-introduces #10981

body:
I'm still experiencing this issue on Linux. In two different windows of the same application, whether via `npm run tauri dev` or the compiled binary, the `localStorage` is not synced.
tauri info output

issue.title: [bug] localStorage not syncing between multiple windows on Linux

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

`localStorage`, `sessionStorage`, etc. is not synced between two instances of an app, even if the window labels are the same. This is a large problem on apps that can have multiple windows open and rely on `localStorage` for data.

### Reproduction

- Create a new Tauri project using the latest Tauri versions
- Make a simple button to update a key in `localStorage` and one to print the current value of the key
- Run `npm run tauri build` and start two instances of the compiled binary (`./src-tauri/target/release/(app-binary)` in two terminal windows)
- Click the buttons in both windows and observe how `localStorage` is not synchronized across both instances. It doesn't sync until you close and reopen an instance.

### Expected behavior

`localStorage`, `sessionStorage`, etc. should be synchronized across all instances of an app, especially when the windows have the same label!

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: EndeavourOS Rolling Release x86_64 (X64) (KDE on wayland)

[-] Plugins
```

### Additional context
